name: Julie Payette
name-long: Her Excellency The Right Honourable Julie Payette

anecdotes.title: Education
anecdotes.body: Julie completed a BEng in electrical engineering in 1986 (McGill), and an MASc in computer engineering in 1990 (Toronto). Her thesis focused on computational linguistics, a field of artificial intelligence.

anecdotes.title: Career in Computing
anecdotes.body: She worked as a systems engineer for IBM Canada's Science Engineering division in a high-performance computer architecture project. In 1991, she joined the Communications and Science Department of the IBM Zurich Research Laboratory in Switzerland. In 1992, she joined Bell-Northern Research in Montreal where she led a project in telephone speech comprehension using computer voice recognition.

anecdotes.title: NASA and NATO
anecdotes.body: From 1992 to 2013, She worked as an astronaut and flew two missions in space. She served as a technical advisor for the Mobile Servicing System, an advanced robotics system and Canada's contribution to the International Space Station. In 1993, she built the Human-Computer Interaction Group at the Canadian Astronaut Program and worked in the NATO International Research Study Group on speech processing.

anecdotes.title: Governor General
anecdotes.body: Julie was announced on July 13, 2017, as Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's recommendation to be the 29th Governor General of Canada.
